RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AUNT TOOTY rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept sharp through the lane. NINETY PROOF raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and settled for second best. VIESTE saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little further. ITSUPTOME stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. FLATTERING WAY raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LOCKDOWN VANNA stumbled and lost her rider into the first turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Aunt Tooty
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Itsuptome
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p 1st turn,chased 7/16,4p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 88. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE OCTOBER 6, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 6 Allo wed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased to the outside of the pace-setter into the stretch, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. MELODIOUS SINGER rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. VOLNAY was brushed leaving the gate then stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. SHERIFF'S KID rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. KATY THE CAT settled off the rail on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. FLAVA'S DREAM settled in the two and three paths the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path. R WORKING GIRL came away awkwardly and made light contact with Volnay, tapered in and stalked two deep the first turn but gave way leaving the three eighths pole and was eased the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Volnay
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed break,stalked off rail,chased 7/16,3p far turn,even fnish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKANI came away awkwardly and out then tapered to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, drifted into the lane and was steadily handled to hold on well. MITOLE CANDY settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then dug in from the head of the lane to take second later yards. JUNE BELLE rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and finished well while gaining on the runner-up. MALIBU YEARS was forced outward leaving the gate then stalked off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at a close disadvantage in the three path on the far turn but flattened stride nearing mid-stretch. ANOTHER FINE JUBA was forced outward leaving the gate then rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. GIRLS PERFUME tapered in and stalked two deep, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the three path on the far turn. SOMESUGARNSPICE veered outward leaving the gate then saved ground, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. VICE ON ICE dropped well back early on. PARALLAX VIEW saved early ground. CEDAR'S IMAGE saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Somesugarnspice
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Another Fine Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,rated close,chased 7/16,rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Mitole Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,bid 7/16,4p far turn,dug in lane,up 2nd late yds

ENTRY.NAME: June Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BESTLA pressured the pace and raced two deep on the turn, took the nod toward mid-stretch, drew briefly clear in later yards and held on. LIKELY CHOICE gave chase, rounded the turn in the two and three paths, dug in for second later yards and was gaining on the winner. COMIDA COMIDA exchanged contact with Talented Corinna leaving the gate then accelerated to the lead and set a pressured pace at mostly even terms, contested the rail through the turn, gave up the lead toward mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. SURCHARGE chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. TALENTED CORINNA was bumped off stride at the start then gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened later yards. WATERLOO ROSE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. STOPWATCHSONNY chased the early pace outside, entered the turn about the six path, angled in toward the head of the lane and showed little more. HOWSAFEAREMYCOLORS gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn, drifted leaving the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Comida Comida
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,up 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Bestla
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,2d turn,nod near 1/16,briefly clear,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Surcharge
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE OCTOBER 6, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAYJAYDEE tapered in and stalked from the three path the first turn, closed to the front approaching the five sixteenths pole, dueled clear approaching the head of the lane, was steadily handled to extend his lead to mid-stretch then taken in hand late yards. RIDICULOUS settled in the two and three paths the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, angled to the five path on the far turn, left the turn outside and dug in to take second later yards. ANTIPOISON angled to the four path into the opening turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and dueled through the stretch for third. SCOTTSDALE moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met toward the five sixteenths and raced close at the rail most of the far turn, but dropped back approaching the head of the lane and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. UNCAPTURED KING raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened stride. PYEONG CHANG saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little further. RAISE A SPEIGHTS stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARPERSGONEFISHING veered in leaving the gate then raced with a slim lead inside on the opening turn, was met toward the three eighths pole and dueled with a slight disadvantage from that point, checked in tight at the rail midway on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take the nod in the final stride. DOCTOR PARDO exchanged contact with Red Hot Toddy leaving the gate then saved ground, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take second under the wire. LASTWALKTOFREEDOM was a bit reluctant to load then tapered in and raced with the pace through the front stretch, stalked into the backstretch and challenged approaching the three eighths pole, dueled with the advantage from that point and drew clear midway on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. LIEUTENANT BROWN rounded the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little further. RED HOT TODDY exchanged contact with Doctor Pardo leaving the gate then settled off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. MONKEY WRENCH raced in the four path the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths then weakened. COMEONTURNMELOOSE was forced inward leaving the gate, saved ground well back on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. HILLBILLY ROCK was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Pardo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,bid 3/8,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,up 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Harpersgonefishing
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since August 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAN ANDREWS settled off the rail on the first turn, rallied to the lead three wide approaching the three eighths pole, raced clear at the five sixteenths, widened near the rail on the far turn then kept alert to mid-stretch before being taken in hand. MARK DID IT saved ground into the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole but proved no match for the winner and had to settle for second. VAIL OF HONOR angled in entering the first turn and raced well back from early contention, started a bid leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and finished evenly to take third the final stride. SPUNMAN settled in the three path the first turn then saved ground on the second turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. ROCKY DICE raced off the rail on the first turn and never factored. LANGLEE AVENUE settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole but weakened into the far turn. OVER AND THUNDER took over into the first turn and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was caught toward the three eighths and weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Langlee Avenue
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Vail of Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in early,well off pace,bid 5/16,3p far turn,along 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAGGERSDALE set a pressured pace and contested even terms at the rail on the turn, then dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game challenge of SWEET SYNTAX, who was forced inward and into Seize The Breeze leaving the gate then closed and dueled at mostly even terms past the three eighths pole, contested the turn two deep and dug in gamely to the finish. RUNAWAY ROAD veered in leaving the gate then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for third. SEIZE THE BREEZE was bumped then shuffled back on the chute, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. D TACHYON chased toward mid track, angled to the seven path through the turn, left the turn widest and passed some rivals. SURF CITY GOLD gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. PERSONAL FINANCE stumbled leaving the gate but quickly recovered to take a brief early lead, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, dropped back approaching the five sixteenths, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened. SAAFEN gave chase, raced in the three and four paths on the turn and showed little in the lane. SKY OF GOLD gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

ENTRY.NAME: D Tachyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid track,angled 7p turn,widest lane,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Haggersdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,even terms rail turn,determinedly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Syntax
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in break,dueled past 3/8,even terms 2d turn,game to wire
